alert.note: Alert for Henderson; Transylvania (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 04 at 7:00AM EST until February 05 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the French Broad River At Blantyre affecting Transylvania and Henderson Counties... ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive runoff continues. * WHERE...French Broad River At Blantyre. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, farmland flooding on both sides of the river occurs and floodwaters begin to impact boat access areas at Grove Bridge and Crab Creek Roads. At 17.0 feet, Floodwaters continue to inundate farmland between the French Broad River and the railroad tracks. Floodwaters may start to inundate the shoulders of River Road near the Big Willow Road intersection. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 AM EST Friday the stage was 15.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of near 17.0 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Action stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement should be issued this evening before 700 PM EST.
